greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = (Sum_{d|n} (sigma(d))) mod sigma(n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: a(A000040(n)) = 1; the only composite number < 2*10^6 with a(n) = 1 is 636.
a(n) = n only for numbers 4, 10 and 96 < 3000000.
example: For n = 4; a(4) = ((sigma(1) + sigma(2) + sigma(4)) mod sigma(4) = (1+3+7) mod 7 = 11 mod 7 = 4.
mathematica: Table[Mod[Sum[DivisorSigma[1, d], {d, Divisors[n]}], DivisorSigma[1, n]], {n, 1, 100}] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Sep 26 2018 *)
program: (MAGMA) [&+[SumOfDivisors(d): d in Divisors(n)] mod  SumOfDivisors(n): n in [1..1000]]
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Sep 16 2018
